unnormalised: What are some good online learning platforms for students in India?
normalised: What are some good online learning platforms for students in India?

unnormalised: Well, there are a lot of options these days! For school kids, Byju's and Vedantu are pretty popular, especially for subjects like Maths and Science. They have good video lectures and practice tests. I know a lot of parents who prepone their kids other activities just for these classes. My nephew scored 90% in his 10th boards using Vedantu, so it seems to work for some. Just remember, their marketing can be a bit aggressive, so do your research before subscribing.
normalised: Well, there are a lot of options these days! For school kids, B-Y-J-U's and Vedantu are pretty popular, especially for subjects like Maths and Science. They have good video lectures and practice tests. I know a lot of parents who prepone their kids other activities just for these classes. My nephew scored ninety percent in his tenth boards using Vedantu, so it seems to work for some. Just remember, their marketing can be a bit aggressive, so do your research before subscribing.

unnormalised: For college students or those looking to upskill, Coursera, Udemy, and edX are great. You can find courses on almost anything, from coding to marketing. I saw a course on AI from Stanford on Coursera for just $49! Plus, many offer certificates upon completion, which can help your resume. If you're looking for something specific to India, NPTEL (from IITs) is also a solid choice, and often free!
normalised: For college students or those looking to upskill, Coursera, Udemy, and E-D-X are great. You can find courses on almost anything, from coding to marketing. I saw a course on A-I from Stanford on Coursera for just dollar forty nine! Plus, many offer certificates upon completion, which can help your resume. If you're looking for something specific to India, N-P-T-E-L (from I-I-T's) is also a solid choice, and often free!

unnormalised: Finally, don't forget YouTube! There are tons of free channels with excellent educational content. Just search for your topic, and you'll likely find something useful. For example, "Physics Wallah" has become super famous, especially for JEE prep. Just be mindful of the source and cross-check info where possible. Good luck with your learning journey!
normalised: Finally, don't forget YouTube! There are tons of free channels with excellent educational content. Just search for your topic, and you'll likely find something useful. For example, "Physics Wallah" has become super famous, especially for J-E-E prep. Just be mindful of the source and cross-check info where possible. Good luck with your learning journey!
